- Massachusetts General Laws, Chapter 26.raw_text: - Massachusetts General Laws, Chapter 260, Section 2A (statute of limitations for actions on account of negligence; three-year limitation applicable to personal injury).
- Massachusetts General Laws, Chapter 26.proposition: The duties and standards applied to a landlord’s maintenance obligations and to premises liability claims in Massachusetts are well-established in statute, regulation, and case law. Relevant authorities include, without limitation:

- Massachusetts General Laws, Chapter 14.raw_text: - Massachusetts General Laws, Chapter 148 (statutes and regulations concerning building and safety standards, including smoke detector requirements for residential premises).
- Massachusetts General Laws, Chapter 14.proposition: The duties and standards applied to a landlord’s maintenance obligations and to premises liability claims in Massachusetts are well-established in statute, regulation, and case law. Relevant authorities include, without limitation:

- 105 C.M.R. 410.000 et seq. (Massachuse.raw_text: - 105 C.M.R. 410.000 et seq. (Massachusetts State Sanitary Code — Minimum Standards of Fitness for Human Habitation), which includes requirements for smoke detectors and tenant safety in residential dwellings.
